| Do we clearly and comprehensively understand our customers' and stakeholders' values and needs, and have we prioritized them? | Creativity, Taking The Initiative | Understanding and prioritizing customer and stakeholder needs requires creative thinking and proactive initiative. | Customer Empathy | Market Research | Customer-Centric Focus |
| Are our products and services well-defined with a clear value proposition that is fully aligned with our mission and goals? | Creativity, Taking The Initiative | Defining products and services with a clear value proposition aligned with the mission and goals requires creative problem-solving and initiative. | Value Proposition Development | Alignment | Mission-Driven Approach |

| Does our shareholder structure support organizational growth? | Coping with Uncertainty, Ambiguity & Risk | Ensuring the shareholder structure supports growth requires navigating uncertainties and risks. | Capital Structure Optimization | Shareholder Analysis | Long-Term Orientation |
| Are our employees appropriately incentivized and represented through shared rewards and governance structures? | Ethical & Sustainable Thinking | Implementing appropriate employee incentives and representation aligns with ethical and sustainable thinking. | Incentive Design | Participatory Governance | Fairness and Equity |
| Do our board members demonstrate a commitment to the organization's mission and vision and represent a range of fields and areas of expertise relevant to the organization? | Mobilizing Others | Assembling a committed and diverse board requires the ability to mobilize and engage individuals with relevant expertise. | Board Composition | Stakeholder Mapping | Diversity and Inclusion |
| Does each strategic goal include 1-3 specific metrics by which the organization can regularly track progress in achieving the goals? | Self-Awareness & Self-Efficacy | Setting specific, measurable goals and tracking progress requires self-awareness and self-efficacy. | Goal Setting | Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) | Accountability |
| Are our shareholders strategic and active? | Mobilizing Others | Engaging strategic and active shareholders involves mobilizing and aligning their interests with the organization. | Shareholder Engagement | Investor Relations | Value Creation Focus |
| Do we have a clear, inspiring, and achievable mission, vision, and values? | Creativity, Taking The Initiative | Developing a clear, inspiring, and achievable mission, vision, and values requires creative thinking and proactive initiative. | Vision Articulation | Inspirational Leadership | Purpose-Driven Mindset |
| Do we have concrete operational plans that are linked to our strategic plan and do we apply them systematically? | Self-Awareness & Self-Efficacy | Developing and systematically applying operational plans linked to the strategic plan requires self-awareness and self-efficacy. | Operational Planning | Strategic Execution | Discipline and Consistency |
| Does the board have a proven track record of investing financially in the organization? | Mobilizing Others | Mobilizing the board to invest financially in the organization requires effective engagement and persuasion skills. | Board Engagement | Financial Stewardship | Commitment to Growth |

The two new columns, "Key Competency" and "Supportive Mindset," provide additional insights into the specific skills and mindsets that can contribute to effectively addressing each strategy-related question within the organizational assessment.

To update the main question and create a table that assesses an individual's level of skill in achieving each organizational element question area, I will follow these steps:

1. Identify the key skill or competency required to effectively address each organizational element question.
2. Rephrase the original question to focus on assessing the individual's skill level in that specific area.
3. Ensure that the new skill-focused question aligns with the original organizational element question.
4. Add three more columns to provide additional context and ensure the quality and helpfulness of the skill-focused question.

Here's the resulting table:

| Original Question | Skill-Focused Question | Key Skill | Relevance to Original Question | Proficiency Levels | Learning Opportunities |
|-------------------|------------------------|-----------|--------------------------------|--------------------|-----------------------|
| Do we clearly and comprehensively understand our customers' and stakeholders' values and needs, and have we prioritized them? | How proficient are you at conducting market research to understand and prioritize customer and stakeholder needs? | Market Research | Directly addresses the understanding and prioritization of customer and stakeholder needs. | Novice, Intermediate, Advanced, Expert | Conducting customer interviews, analyzing market trends, creating customer personas |
| Are our products and services well-defined with a clear value proposition that is fully aligned with our mission and goals? | How skilled are you at developing value propositions that align with the organization's mission and goals? | Value Proposition Development | Focuses on the individual's ability to define products and services with clear value propositions aligned with the mission and goals. | Novice, Intermediate, Advanced, Expert | Crafting unique selling points, conducting competitive analysis, aligning offerings with mission |
| Are our products and services offerings linked to one another and our overall strategy? | How adept are you at managing a portfolio of products and services to ensure strategic alignment? | Portfolio Management | Addresses the individual's skill in linking products and services to each other and the overall strategy. | Novice, Intermediate, Advanced, Expert | Conducting portfolio analysis, identifying synergies, ensuring strategic fit |
| Does our shareholder structure support organizational growth? | How well-versed are you in optimizing capital structures to support organizational growth? | Capital Structure Optimization | Assesses the individual's skill in ensuring the shareholder structure supports growth. | Novice, Intermediate, Advanced, Expert | Analyzing shareholder structures, evaluating financing options, balancing risk and return |
| Are our employees appropriately incentivized and represented through shared rewards and governance structures? | How skilled are you at designing incentive systems that align with ethical and sustainable practices? | Incentive Design | Focuses on the individual's ability to implement appropriate employee incentives and representation. | Novice, Intermediate, Advanced, Expert | Developing performance-based rewards, promoting employee ownership, ensuring fairness and transparency |
| Do our board members demonstrate a commitment to the organization's mission and vision and represent a range of fields and areas of expertise relevant to the organization? | How proficient are you at identifying and engaging diverse board members who are committed to the organization's mission and vision? | Board Composition | Addresses the individual's skill in assembling a committed and diverse board with relevant expertise. | Novice, Intermediate, Advanced, Expert | Identifying skills gaps, recruiting diverse candidates, aligning board with mission |

- Implementing risk management strategies | | Are our revenue-generating activities aligned with the core mission and strategy of the organization? | Key skill: Revenue Alignment

- Implementing risk management strategies | | Are our revenue-generating activities aligned with the core mission and strategy of the organization? | Key skill: Revenue Alignment

- Developing an integrated reporting framework
- Communicating integrated results to stakeholders |

Craft a question assessing proficiency in messaging consistency | How skilled are you at ensuring all organizational communications convey consistent and compelling messages? | Addresses the individual's ability to align and strengthen communication effectiveness | - Developing a core messaging framework

3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in communication strategy development | How adept are you at creating and regularly updating a comprehensive communication strategy that informs execution plans? | Focuses on the individual's ability to establish and maintain a strategic approach to communications | - Conducting stakeholder and market analysis

- Establishing processes for regular strategy reviews and updates | | Do we know who our key stakeholders are and what they value? | Key skill: Stakeholder Analysis
1. Recognize the importance of identifying key stakeholders and understanding their values
2. Identify skills required for effective stakeholder analysis
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How proficient are you at identifying the organization's key stakeholders and understanding their values and priorities? | Addresses the individual's skill in analyzing and prioritizing stakeholder needs and expectations | - Mapping stakeholder groups and their relationships
- Conducting stakeholder surveys and interviews
- Analyzing stakeholder feedback to identify common themes and values | | Do we customize communications to each of our key stakeholders? | Key skill: Stakeholder-Specific Communication

2. Determine skills needed to effectively customize communications
3. Create a question evaluating skill level in stakeholder-specific communication | How skilled are you at tailoring communication messages and channels to the specific needs and preferences of each key stakeholder group? | Focuses on the individual's ability to adapt communications to resonate with different stakeholders | - Segmenting stakeholders based on communication needs
- Developing targeted messaging and content
- Selecting appropriate communication channels for each stakeholder group | | Can our community and communication efforts support strong partnerships/supplier relationships? | Key skill: Relationship-Building Communication
1. Recognize the potential for communications to support strong partnerships and supplier relationships
2. Identify skills required for effective relationship-building communication
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How adept are you at leveraging community engagement and communication efforts to foster strong partnerships and supplier relationships? | Addresses the individual's skill in using communications to strengthen external relationships | - Identifying partnership and supplier communication needs
- Developing collaborative communication initiatives
- Measuring the impact of communication on relationship quality | | Do we regularly identify and deliver new partners for community/communications opportunities? | Key skill: Partnership Identification
1. Understand the importance of regularly identifying new partners for community and communication opportunities
2. Determine skills needed to effectively identify and engage new partners
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in partnership identification | How proficient are you at consistently identifying and securing new partners for community engagement and communication initiatives? | Focuses on the individual's ability to expand the organization's partner network | - Researching potential partners and their alignment with organizational goals
- Developing compelling partnership proposals
- Negotiating and formalizing partnership agreements | | Is our website continuously maintained and up-to-date on current developments in the organization as well as its industry/domain (as relevant)? | Key skill: Website Content Management
1. Recognize the significance of keeping the website current and relevant
2. Identify skills required for effective website content management
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How skilled are you at ensuring the organization's website is continuously updated with current organizational and industry developments? | Addresses the individual's skill in maintaining a fresh and informative website | - Establishing processes for regular website content reviews and updates
- Collaborating with internal teams to gather relevant content
- Optimizing website content for user engagement and search engines | | Do we receive praise for our website's user-friendliness and depth of information? | Key skill: User Experience (UX) Design
1. Understand the importance of having a user-friendly website with comprehensive information
2. Determine skills needed to effectively design and maintain a praised website
3. Create a question evaluating skill level in UX design | How adept are you at designing and maintaining a website that consistently receives praise for its user-friendliness and depth of information? | Focuses on the individual's ability to create a website that excels in usability and content quality | - Conducting user research and usability testing
- Applying UX design principles to website structure and navigation
- Organizing and presenting content for clarity and depth |

messages.content:
Here is the table with the thinking process, skill-focused question, relevance, and learning opportunities for the Team, Leadership, Staff & Volunteers questions: | Original Question | Thinking Process | Skill-Focused Question | Relevance | Learning Opportunities | |-------------------|------------------|------------------------|-----------|------------------------| | Are most of our staff eager and able to take on special projects and collaborate across divisional lines? | Key skill: Cross-Functional Collaboration
1. Recognize the importance of staff willingness and ability to collaborate across divisions
2. Identify skills needed to foster cross-functional collaboration
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in promoting cross-functional collaboration | How adept are you at encouraging and enabling staff to enthusiastically take on special projects and collaborate effectively across different departments or divisions? | Addresses the individual's ability to create a culture of collaboration and initiative among staff | - Promoting the benefits of cross-functional collaboration
- Providing opportunities for staff to work on diverse projects
- Facilitating communication and knowledge sharing across teams | | Is our staff drawn from diverse backgrounds and experiences and brings a broad range of skills? | Key skill: Diversity and Inclusion
1. Understand the significance of having a staff with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and skills
2. Determine skills needed to effectively build and manage a diverse team
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in fostering diversity and inclusion | How skilled are you at attracting, hiring, and managing a staff with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and a wide array of skills? | Focuses on the individual's ability to build and lead a diverse and skilled team | - Implementing inclusive recruiting and hiring practices
- Creating a welcoming and equitable work environment
- Providing diversity and inclusion training for all staff | | Do our reporting structures represent the reality of the operations? | Key skill: Organizational Design
1. Recognize the importance of having reporting structures that accurately reflect operational realities
2. Identify skills required for effective organizational design
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How proficient are you at designing and maintaining reporting structures that accurately represent the organization's operational realities? | Addresses the individual's skill in aligning reporting structures with actual work processes | - Analyzing current reporting structures and operational processes
- Identifying discrepancies and inefficiencies in reporting lines
- Redesigning reporting structures to better reflect operational needs | | Does our CEO/ED take an active interest in managerial development? | Key skill: Leadership Development
1. Understand the significance of the CEO/ED actively engaging in managerial development
2. Determine skills needed to effectively demonstrate interest and invest in managerial growth
3. Create a question evaluating skill level in leadership development | How adept are you, as a CEO/ED, at actively demonstrating interest and investing in the development of managerial skills among your team? | Focuses on the individual's ability to prioritize and support the growth of managerial talent | - Regularly meeting with managers to discuss their development goals
- Providing resources and opportunities for managerial skill-building
- Modeling effective leadership behaviors and practices | | Is our organizational chart clear with defined roles? | Key skill: Role Clarity
1. Recognize the importance of having a clear organizational chart with well-defined roles
2. Identify skills required for effectively defining and communicating roles
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How skilled are you at developing and maintaining a clear organizational chart with well-defined roles and responsibilities? | Addresses the individual's skill in ensuring clarity and understanding of roles throughout the organization | - Conducting a comprehensive review of current roles and responsibilities
- Collaborating with team members to clarify and document role expectations
- Regularly updating and communicating the organizational chart | | Do we have comprehensive variable compensation plans strategically developed for different teams? | Key skill: Compensation Strategy
1. Understand the significance of having strategically designed variable compensation plans for different teams
2. Determine skills needed to effectively develop and implement variable compensation strategies
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in compensation strategy | How adept are you at designing and implementing comprehensive variable compensation plans that are strategically tailored to the needs and goals of different teams? | Focuses on the individual's ability to create effective and motivating compensation structures | - Analyzing market data and industry benchmarks for compensation
- Aligning variable compensation with team and organizational objectives

messages.content:
Here is the table with the thinking process, skill-focused question, relevance, and learning opportunities for the Innovation & Learning questions: | Original Question | Thinking Process | Skill-Focused Question | Relevance | Learning Opportunities | |-------------------|------------------|------------------------|-----------|------------------------| | Do we use open-source methods to build off existing models? | Key skill: Open-Source Utilization
1. Recognize the importance of leveraging open-source methods to build upon existing models
2. Identify skills needed to effectively utilize open-source resources
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in open-source utilization | How proficient are you at identifying and adapting relevant open-source methods and models to drive innovation within the organization? | Addresses the individual's ability to leverage open-source resources for innovation and efficiency | - Researching and evaluating open-source models and frameworks
- Adapting open-source methods to fit organizational needs
- Contributing back to open-source communities and projects | | Do we actively encourage and provide the safety and resources to drive experimentation and learning? Ex: Organization provides space, time, resources for learning, sabbaticals, etc. | Key skill: Innovation Culture
1. Understand the significance of actively encouraging and supporting experimentation and learning
2. Determine skills needed to effectively foster an innovation culture
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in promoting innovation culture | How adept are you at creating and maintaining a culture that actively encourages and provides the necessary safety and resources to drive experimentation and learning? | Focuses on the individual's ability to cultivate an environment conducive to innovation and continuous learning | - Developing policies and programs that encourage experimentation
- Allocating resources (time, space, budget) for learning and innovation
- Recognizing and rewarding innovative efforts and risk-taking | | Are most of our staff committed to continuous learning? | Key skill: Continuous Learning Mindset
1. Recognize the importance of having staff committed to continuous learning
2. Identify skills required for effectively promoting a continuous learning mindset
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How skilled are you at fostering a continuous learning mindset among staff and ensuring that most employees are actively engaged in ongoing learning and development? | Addresses the individual's skill in cultivating a strong desire for continuous learning across the organization | - Communicating the value and importance of continuous learning
- Providing diverse learning opportunities and resources
- Incorporating learning goals into performance expectations and reviews | | Are we capable and motivated to innovate, adjust or create new products, services, or programs to meet the needs of key clients or high-potential new market segments or geographies? | Key skill: Market-Driven Innovation
1. Understand the significance of being capable and motivated to innovate based on market needs and opportunities
2. Determine skills needed to effectively drive market-driven innovation
3. Create a question evaluating skill level in market-driven innovation | How adept are you at assessing market needs and opportunities and driving the innovation, adjustment, or creation of products, services, or programs to meet the requirements of key clients or high-potential new market segments or geographies? | Focuses on the individual's ability to align innovation efforts with market demands and growth potential | - Conducting market research and client needs assessments
- Identifying high-potential market segments and geographies
- Developing and implementing market-responsive innovation strategies | | Are we seen as an innovation leader in our field and occasionally invited to speak at relevant conferences? | Key skill: Thought Leadership
1. Recognize the importance of being perceived as an innovation leader and receiving speaking invitations
2. Identify skills required for effectively establishing thought leadership
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How proficient are you at positioning the organization as an innovation leader in its field, resulting in occasional invitations to speak at relevant conferences and events? | Addresses the individual's skill in building the organization's reputation as an innovation thought leader | - Developing and sharing innovative ideas and insights
- Participating in industry events and discussions
- Seeking out and accepting speaking opportunities at relevant conferences | | Do our employees source ideas and experiment rigorously to uncover new insights and learnings that are rapidly incorporated and adapt to new solutions as uncovered? | Key skill: Rapid Experimentation
1. Understand the significance of employees sourcing ideas, experimenting, and rapidly adapting based on new insights
2. Determine skills needed to effectively facilitate rapid experimentation and adaptation
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in rapid experimentation | How skilled are you at empowering and guiding employees to source ideas, conduct rigorous experiments, uncover new insights, and rapidly incorporate learnings to adapt and develop new solutions? | Focuses on the individual's ability to foster a culture of rapid experimentation and adaptive innovation | - Training employees on effective experimentation techniques
- Establishing processes for capturing and sharing insights
- Encouraging swift incorporation of learnings into solutions | | Do we actively track current trends, read news and blogs, read industry-standard books, and occasionally participate in conferences relevant to the industry? | Key skill: Industry Trend Monitoring
1. Recognize the importance of actively tracking industry trends, news, blogs, books, and conferences
2. Identify skills required for effectively monitoring industry trends
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How adept are you at ensuring that the organization actively tracks current industry trends by reading relevant news, blogs, and books, and occasionally participating in industry conferences? | Addresses the individual's skill in keeping the organization informed and engaged with industry developments | - Identifying key industry information sources and influencers
- Allocating time and resources for industry trend monitoring
- Sharing and discussing industry insights with team members |

messages.content:
Here is the table with the thinking process, skill-focused question, relevance, and learning opportunities for the Legal & Compliance questions: | Original Question | Thinking Process | Skill-Focused Question | Relevance | Learning Opportunities | |-------------------|------------------|------------------------|-----------|------------------------| | Do we have a solid understanding of relevant regulatory requirements and standards? | Key skill: Regulatory Knowledge
1. Recognize the importance of having a solid understanding of relevant regulations and standards
2. Identify skills needed to effectively stay informed about regulatory requirements
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in regulatory knowledge | How proficient are you at ensuring that the organization maintains a comprehensive understanding of all relevant regulatory requirements and standards? | Addresses the individual's ability to keep the organization informed and compliant with applicable regulations | - Identifying and tracking relevant regulations and standards
- Interpreting regulatory requirements and their impact on the organization
- Communicating regulatory knowledge to key stakeholders | | Are we fully prepared and equipped with the necessary expertise and resources to avoid legal issues? | Key skill: Legal Risk Management
1. Understand the significance of being fully prepared to avoid legal issues
2. Determine skills needed to effectively manage legal risks
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in legal risk management | How adept are you at ensuring that the organization is fully prepared and equipped with the necessary expertise and resources to proactively avoid potential legal issues? | Focuses on the individual's ability to proactively mitigate legal risks for the organization | - Conducting legal risk assessments and audits
- Developing and implementing risk mitigation strategies
- Engaging legal experts and resources as needed | | Do we have a clearly developed intellectual property strategy with registered and upcoming trademarks, copyrights, and/or patents? | Key skill: Intellectual Property Management
1. Recognize the importance of having a clearly developed intellectual property (IP) strategy
2. Identify skills required for effectively managing IP assets
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How skilled are you at developing and executing a clear intellectual property strategy that includes registering and managing trademarks, copyrights, and patents? | Addresses the individual's skill in protecting and leveraging the organization's intellectual property | - Identifying and prioritizing IP assets for protection
- Navigating the registration process for trademarks, copyrights, and patents
- Monitoring and enforcing IP rights | | Do we strategically leverage regulatory requirements and relevant standards to benefit our organization? | Key skill: Regulatory Leverage
1. Understand the significance of strategically leveraging regulatory requirements and standards for organizational benefit
2. Determine skills needed to effectively leverage regulations and standards
3. Create a question evaluating skill level in regulatory leverage | How adept are you at identifying opportunities to strategically leverage regulatory requirements and relevant standards in ways that benefit the organization? | Focuses on the individual's ability to turn compliance into a competitive advantage | - Analyzing regulations for potential business opportunities
- Aligning compliance efforts with organizational goals and values
- Communicating the benefits of compliance to stakeholders | | Do we have the capacity to, and in practice, do we address potential legal matters promptly? | Key skill: Legal Issue Resolution
1. Recognize the importance of having the capacity and practice of addressing legal matters promptly
2. Identify skills required for effectively resolving legal issues
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How proficient are you at ensuring that the organization has the capacity and processes in place to identify and address potential legal matters in a timely and effective manner? | Addresses the individual's skill in managing and resolving legal issues for the organization | - Establishing processes for identifying and escalating legal matters
- Collaborating with legal counsel to develop resolution strategies
- Implementing and monitoring the effectiveness of legal resolutions |

Craft a question assessing proficiency in contingency planning | How skilled are you at developing, maintaining, and ensuring the readiness of a comprehensive contingency plan that can be activated when needed? | Addresses the individual's ability to prepare the organization for potential disruptions or crises | - Identifying potential risks and disruption scenarios
- Developing detailed response and recovery plans
- Regularly testing and updating contingency plans | | Is the IT infrastructure adequate, and does it support the organization's short, mid and long-term needs? | Key skill: IT Infrastructure Planning
1. Understand the significance of having an adequate IT infrastructure that supports organizational needs
2. Determine skills needed to effectively plan and manage IT infrastructure
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in IT infrastructure planning | How adept are you at assessing the organization's short, mid, and long-term needs and ensuring that the IT infrastructure is adequate and supportive of those requirements? | Focuses on the individual's ability to align IT infrastructure with organizational goals and needs | - Conducting IT infrastructure assessments and gap analyses
- Developing and implementing IT infrastructure roadmaps
- Monitoring and optimizing IT infrastructure performance | | Do we have a comprehensive electronic database and management reporting system(s) for tracking clients, staff, organization outcomes, and financial information? | Key skill: Data Management
1. Recognize the importance of having comprehensive electronic databases and reporting systems
2. Identify skills required for effectively managing data and reporting
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How proficient are you at designing, implementing, and maintaining comprehensive electronic databases and management reporting systems for tracking key organizational data such as clients, staff, outcomes, and financial information? | Addresses the individual's skill in ensuring the organization has robust data management and reporting capabilities | - Identifying critical data points and metrics to track
- Selecting and configuring appropriate database and reporting tools
- Establishing data governance and quality control processes | | Is everyone on the staff aware of the importance of information security, offered training on best practices, and monitored/held accountable to ensure adequate compliance? | Key skill: Information Security Awareness
1. Understand the significance of staff awareness, training, and accountability for information security
2. Determine skills needed to effectively promote information security awareness and compliance
3. Create a question evaluating skill level in information security awareness | How adept are you at ensuring that all staff members are aware of the importance of information security, provided with training on best practices, and monitored and held accountable for maintaining adequate compliance? | Focuses on the individual's ability to foster a culture of information security awareness and compliance | - Developing and delivering information security awareness training
- Establishing clear information security policies and guidelines
- Implementing monitoring and accountability measures for compliance | | Do we have the necessary information security structures in place and maintained to protect the systems at the organization? | Key skill: Information Security Management
1. Recognize the importance of having necessary information security structures in place and maintained
2. Identify skills required for effectively managing information security
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How skilled are you at establishing, maintaining, and continuously improving the necessary information security structures and processes to protect the organization's systems and data? | Addresses the individual's skill in implementing and managing robust information security measures | - Conducting information security risk assessments
- Designing and implementing security controls and technologies
- Monitoring and responding to security incidents and threats |

Here is the updated table with the thinking process, skill-focused question, relevance, and learning opportunities for the Products and Services questions: | Original Question | Thinking Process | Skill-Focused Question | Relevance | Learning Opportunities | |-------------------|------------------|------------------------|-----------|------------------------| | Do we collect and interpret customer/client feedback effectively and promptly? | Key skill: Customer Feedback Management
1. Recognize the importance of collecting and interpreting customer feedback
2. Identify skills needed to effectively manage customer feedback
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in customer feedback management | How proficient are you at designing and implementing processes to collect, analyze, and act upon customer feedback in a timely and effective manner? | Addresses the individual's ability to gather and utilize customer insights for product and service improvements | - Developing customer feedback collection methods
- Analyzing feedback data to identify trends and insights
- Communicating feedback insights to relevant teams for action | | Do our timelines and budgets have a solid track record of being accurate with only average amounts of iteration? | Key skill: Project Planning and Estimation
1. Understand the significance of accurate timelines and budgets with minimal iterations
2. Determine skills needed to effectively plan and estimate projects
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in project planning and estimation | How skilled are you at creating and managing project timelines and budgets that consistently demonstrate accuracy and require only minimal iterations? | Focuses on the individual's ability to plan and execute projects efficiently and effectively | - Breaking down projects into manageable tasks and milestones
- Estimating resource requirements and durations accurately
- Monitoring and adjusting project plans based on progress and changes | | Do all offerings have an adequate number of dedicated staff? | Key skill: Resource Allocation
1. Recognize the importance of having adequate dedicated staff for each offering
2. Identify skills required for effectively allocating resources
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How adept are you at assessing the staffing requirements for each product or service offering and ensuring the allocation of an adequate number of dedicated team members? | Addresses the individual's skill in optimizing human resources across offerings | - Analyzing workload and skill requirements for each offering
- Matching staff skills and availability to project needs
- Balancing resource allocation to maximize efficiency and quality | | Do we clearly understand our competitive advantage(s) and strategically leverage each of them? | Key skill: Competitive Positioning
1. Understand the significance of identifying and leveraging competitive advantages
2. Determine skills needed to effectively position offerings in the market
3. Create a question evaluating skill level in competitive positioning | How proficient are you at identifying the organization's unique competitive advantages and developing strategies to effectively leverage each of them in the market? | Focuses on the individual's ability to differentiate offerings and capitalize on strengths | - Conducting competitive analysis to identify differentiators
- Developing value propositions that highlight competitive advantages
- Integrating competitive positioning into marketing and sales efforts | | Are our products and services well-planned, including detailed and iterative timelines, budgets, and scenario plans that address real execution risks? | Key skill: Comprehensive Product Planning
1. Recognize the importance of well-planned products and services with risk mitigation
2. Identify skills required for effective product planning and risk management
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How skilled are you at developing comprehensive product and service plans that include detailed timelines, budgets, and scenario plans to address potential execution risks? | Addresses the individual's skill in creating robust and risk-aware product plans | - Defining clear product requirements and specifications
- Identifying and assessing execution risks and mitigation strategies
- Collaborating with cross-functional teams to create integrated plans | | Do we comprehensively understand our core markets, and are we strategically positioned in each of them? | Key skill: Market Positioning
1. Understand the significance of understanding core markets and strategic positioning
2. Determine skills needed to effectively analyze markets and position offerings
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in market positioning | How adept are you at conducting thorough analyses of the organization's core markets and developing strategies to achieve optimal positioning within each market segment? | Focuses on the individual's ability to align offerings with target market needs and preferences | - Segmenting and profiling target markets and customer personas
- Identifying market trends, opportunities, and threats
- Crafting positioning strategies that resonate with each market segment |

Make a table with the original question, a thinking column where you think step by step about what the key skill is and what the skill focused question should be to ensure coverage of the initial question and what the learning opportunities might be, then a column for skill focused question, relevance, and learning opportunity. let's do that for strategy

messages.content:
Here is the table with the thinking process, skill-focused question, relevance, and learning opportunities for the Strategy questions: | Original Question | Thinking Process | Skill-Focused Question | Relevance | Learning Opportunities | |-------------------|------------------|------------------------|-----------|------------------------| | Do we clearly and comprehensively understand our customers' and stakeholders' values and needs, and have we prioritized them? | Key skill: Stakeholder Analysis
1. Recognize the importance of understanding and prioritizing customer and stakeholder needs
2. Identify skills needed to effectively analyze stakeholder values and needs
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in stakeholder analysis | How proficient are you at conducting comprehensive analyses to understand and prioritize the values and needs of the organization's customers and stakeholders? | Addresses the individual's ability to gather and utilize stakeholder insights for strategic decision-making | - Identifying key stakeholder groups and their interests
- Collecting and analyzing stakeholder feedback and data
- Prioritizing stakeholder needs based on impact and alignment with organizational goals | | Are our products and services well-defined with a clear value proposition that is fully aligned with our mission and goals? | Key skill: Value Proposition Development
1. Understand the significance of well-defined products and services with aligned value propositions
2. Determine skills needed to effectively develop and align value propositions
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in value proposition development | How skilled are you at defining clear and compelling value propositions for the organization's products and services that are fully aligned with its mission and goals? | Focuses on the individual's ability to create value propositions that resonate with customers and support organizational objectives | - Identifying unique selling points and differentiators
- Crafting value propositions that address customer needs and preferences
- Ensuring alignment between value propositions and organizational mission and goals | | Are our products and services offerings linked to one another and our overall strategy? | Key skill: Portfolio Management
1. Recognize the importance of linking product and service offerings to each other and the overall strategy
2. Identify skills required for effective portfolio management
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How adept are you at ensuring that the organization's product and service offerings are strategically linked to one another and aligned with the overall corporate strategy? | Addresses the individual's skill in managing a cohesive and strategically aligned portfolio of offerings | - Analyzing the strategic fit and synergies between offerings
- Identifying opportunities for cross-selling and bundling
- Regularly reviewing and optimizing the portfolio for strategic alignment | | Does our shareholder structure support organizational growth? | Key skill: Shareholder Structure Optimization
1. Understand the significance of having a shareholder structure that supports growth
2. Determine skills needed to effectively optimize shareholder structure
3. Create a question evaluating skill level in shareholder structure optimization | How proficient are you at assessing the organization's shareholder structure and identifying opportunities to optimize it for supporting organizational growth? | Focuses on the individual's ability to align shareholder structure with growth objectives | - Analyzing the impact of current shareholder structure on growth
- Identifying potential changes to enhance growth support
- Developing and implementing shareholder structure optimization plans | | Are our employees appropriately incentivized and represented through shared rewards and governance structures? (Such as employee stock option plan, profit-sharing plan, cooperative structure, inclusive decision-making structure, or otherwise.) | Key skill: Employee Incentive Design
1. Recognize the importance of appropriate employee incentives and representation
2. Identify skills required for designing effective employee incentive and governance structures
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How skilled are you at designing and implementing employee incentive and representation structures, such as stock option plans, profit-sharing, cooperative structures, or inclusive decision-making processes, that effectively motivate and engage employees? | Addresses the individual's skill in creating incentive and governance structures that align employee interests with organizational success | - Researching and benchmarking employee incentive and governance best practices
- Designing incentive plans that drive desired behaviors and outcomes
- Communicating and administering incentive and governance programs effectively | | Do our board members demonstrate a commitment to the organization's mission and vision and represent a range of fields and areas of expertise relevant to the organization? (High-profile board members would be great.) | Key skill: Board Composition Management
1. Understand the significance of having a committed and diverse board with relevant expertise
2. Determine skills needed to effectively manage board composition
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in board composition management | How adept are you at identifying and recruiting board members who demonstrate a strong commitment to the organization's mission and vision, represent a diverse range of relevant fields and expertise, and potentially include high-profile individuals? | Focuses on the individual's ability to build and maintain an effective board composition | - Defining ideal board member profiles based on organizational needs
- Identifying and cultivating potential board member candidates
- Assessing and optimizing board diversity and expertise mix | | Does each strategic goal include 1-3 specific metrics by which the organization can regularly track progress in achieving the goals? | Key skill: Goal Metrics Definition
1. Recognize the importance of having specific metrics for each strategic goal
2. Identify skills required for defining effective goal metrics
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How proficient are you at defining 1-3 specific, measurable, and relevant metrics for each of the organization's strategic goals to enable regular tracking of progress towards goal achievement? | Addresses the individual's skill in establishing clear and trackable metrics for strategic goals | - Identifying key performance indicators (KPIs) for each strategic goal
- Ensuring metrics are specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART)
- Communicating and monitoring goal metrics regularly | | Are our shareholders strategic and active? | Key skill: Shareholder Engagement
1. Understand the significance of having strategic and active shareholders
2. Determine skills needed to effectively engage shareholders
3. Create a question evaluating skill level in shareholder engagement | How skilled are you at identifying, attracting, and engaging shareholders who are strategic in their involvement and actively contribute to the organization's success? | Focuses on the individual's ability to build and maintain a strategic and engaged shareholder base | - Defining ideal shareholder profiles and value proposition
- Developing and executing shareholder communication and engagement plans
- Fostering shareholder participation in strategic discussions and decisions | | Do we have a clear, inspiring, and achievable mission, vision, and values? | Key skill: Mission, Vision, and Values Development
1. Recognize the importance of having a clear, inspiring, and achievable mission, vision, and values
2. Identify skills required for developing effective mission, vision, and values statements
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How proficient are you at crafting clear, inspiring, and achievable statements of the organization's mission, vision, and values that guide strategic decision-making and engage stakeholders? | Addresses the individual's skill in creating compelling and guiding mission, vision, and values statements | - Conducting stakeholder input sessions to inform statement development
- Drafting and refining statements for clarity, inspiration, and achievability
- Communicating and integrating statements into organizational culture and practices | | Do we have concrete operational plans that are linked to our strategic plan and do we apply them systematically? | Key skill: Operational Planning
1. Understand the significance of having operational plans linked to the strategic plan and systematically applied
2. Determine skills needed to effectively develop and execute operational plans
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in operational planning | How adept are you at developing concrete operational plans that are clearly linked to the organization's strategic plan and ensuring their systematic application across the organization? | Focuses on the individual's ability to translate strategic plans into actionable operational plans and ensure their execution | - Cascading strategic objectives into operational goals and tactics
- Defining clear roles, responsibilities, and timelines for operational plan execution
- Monitoring and adjusting operational plans based on performance and strategic alignment | | Does the board have a proven track record of investing financially in the organization? | Key skill: Board Financial Engagement
1. Recognize the importance of having a board with a track record of financial investment in the organization
2. Identify skills required for effectively engaging the board in financial investment
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How skilled are you at cultivating and sustaining a board of directors with a proven track record of making significant financial investments in the organization? | Addresses the individual's skill in securing financial commitment and investment from the board | - Educating the board on the organization's financial needs and opportunities
- Presenting compelling investment cases and return on investment (ROI) projections
- Stewarding board relationships to maintain and grow financial engagement |

2. Identify skills required for defining effective goal metrics
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How proficient are you at defining 1-3 specific, measurable, and relevant metrics for each of the organization's strategic goals to enable regular tracking of progress towards goal achievement? | Addresses the individual's skill in establishing clear and trackable metrics for strategic goals | - Identifying key performance indicators (KPIs) for each strategic goal
- Ensuring metrics are specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART)
- Communicating and monitoring goal metrics regularly | | Are our shareholders strategic and active? | Key skill: Shareholder Engagement
1. Understand the significance of having strategic and active shareholders
2. Determine skills needed to effectively engage shareholders
3. Create a question evaluating skill level in shareholder engagement | How skilled are you at identifying, attracting, and engaging shareholders who are strategic in their involvement and actively contribute to the organization's success? | Focuses on the individual's ability to build and maintain a strategic and engaged shareholder base | - Defining ideal shareholder profiles and value proposition
- Developing and executing shareholder communication and engagement plans
- Fostering shareholder participation in strategic discussions and decisions | | Do we have a clear, inspiring, and achievable mission, vision, and values? | Key skill: Mission, Vision, and Values Development
1. Recognize the importance of having a clear, inspiring, and achievable mission, vision, and values
2. Identify skills required for developing effective mission, vision, and values statements
3. Craft a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How proficient are you at crafting clear, inspiring, and achievable statements of the organization's mission, vision, and values that guide strategic decision-making and engage stakeholders? | Addresses the individual's skill in creating compelling and guiding mission, vision, and values statements | - Conducting stakeholder input sessions to inform statement development
- Drafting and refining statements for clarity, inspiration, and achievability
- Communicating and integrating statements into organizational culture and practices | | Do we have concrete operational plans that are linked to our strategic plan and do we apply them systematically? | Key skill: Operational Planning
1. Understand the significance of having operational plans linked to the strategic plan and systematically applied
2. Determine skills needed to effectively develop and execute operational plans
3. Formulate a question evaluating skill level in operational planning | How adept are you at developing concrete operational plans that are clearly linked to the organization's strategic plan and ensuring their systematic application across the organization? | Focuses on the individual's ability to translate strategic plans into actionable operational plans and ensure their execution | - Cascading strategic objectives into operational goals and tactics
- Defining clear roles, responsibilities, and timelines for operational plan execution
- Monitoring and adjusting operational plans based on performance and strategic alignment | | Does the board have a proven track record of investing financially in the organization? | Key skill: Board Financial Engagement
1. Recognize the importance of having a board with a track record of financial investment in the organization
2. Identify skills required for effectively engaging the board in financial investment
3. Develop a question assessing proficiency in this skill | How skilled are you at cultivating and sustaining a board of directors with a proven track record of making significant financial investments in the organization? | Addresses the individual's skill in securing financial commitment and investment from the board | - Educating the board on the organization's financial needs and opportunities
- Presenting compelling investment cases and return on investment (ROI) projections
- Stewarding board relationships to maintain and grow financial engagement |

messages.content:
Here's a step-by-step approach to creating a table with documents, SOPs, processes, templates, and worksheets that a company can use to address each ECAT category:

Goal: Develop a comprehensive set of resources to help companies effectively manage and improve their performance in each ECAT category.

Plan:
1. Review each ECAT category and its aligned EntreComp threads.
2. Identify key areas where documents, SOPs, processes, templates, and worksheets can support a company's efforts in each category.
3. Brainstorm specific resources for each key area.
4. Organize the resources into a table format with columns for the ECAT category, key areas, and specific resources.

Table:

| ECAT Category | Key Area | Document/SOP/Process | Template/Worksheet | Additional Resources |
|---------------|----------|---------------------|-------------------|----------------------|
| ğŸ¯ Strategy | Strategic Planning | Strategic Planning Process | SWOT Analysis Template | Scenario Planning Guide |
| | Goal Setting | OKR Framework SOP | SMART Goals Worksheet | KPI Library |
| | Risk Management | Risk Management Process | Risk Assessment Matrix | Contingency Planning Guide |
| ğŸ“² Products and Services | Product Development | Product Development Process | User Story Template | Design Thinking Toolkit |
| | Service Design | Service Blueprint SOP | Customer Journey Map | Service Level Agreement Template |
| ğŸ’¶ Revenues & Financial Management | Financial Planning | Budgeting Process | Financial Forecast Template | Financial Metrics Glossary |
| | Resource Management | Resource Allocation SOP | Capacity Planning Worksheet | Project Management Guide |
| ğŸ«¶ğŸ½ Social Impact & Sustainability (CSR/ESG, MER) | CSR Strategy | CSR Policy | Stakeholder Mapping Template | Sustainability Reporting Framework |
| | Impact Assessment | Impact Measurement Process | Theory of Change Template | Social Return on Investment Calculator |
| ğŸ¤ Marketing, Communications & Community | Marketing Planning | Marketing Plan SOP | Buyer Persona Template | Content Marketing Guide |
| | Stakeholder Engagement | Communication Plan | Stakeholder Analysis Worksheet | Community Engagement Toolkit |
| ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ Team, Leadership, Staff & Volunteers | Performance Management | Performance Review Process | SMART Goals Worksheet | 360-Degree Feedback Template |
| | Team Development | Team Charter Template | Team Building Activities Guide | Conflict Resolution SOP |
| ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ« Innovation & Learning | Innovation Management | Innovation Process | Idea Evaluation Matrix | Design Sprint Guide |
| | Knowledge Management | Knowledge Sharing SOP | Lessons Learned Template | Communities of Practice Guide |
| ğŸ§‘ğŸ½â€âš–ï¸ Legal & Compliance | Compliance Management | Compliance Policy | Compliance Checklist | Industry Regulations Guide |
| | Contract Management | Contract Lifecycle Management SOP | Contract Template Library | Intellectual Property Guide |
| âš ï¸ Infrastructure, Risk, Security & Resilience | Business Continuity | Business Continuity Plan | Impact Analysis Worksheet | Disaster Recovery Guide |
| | Information Security | Information Security Policy | Risk Assessment Template | Cybersecurity Best Practices Guide |

This table provides a starting point for companies to identify and develop the necessary resources to support their efforts in each ECAT category. The specific documents, SOPs, processes, templates, and worksheets may vary depending on the company's size, industry, and unique needs.

For each ecat category identify 3 possible worksheets for each stage: think step by step about thow to set up the table, what worksheets are valid for each stage and make a table:
0. LEARNING0.1 Learning without the goal of launching an enterprise1. IDEATION1.1 Want to start and looking for/testing ideas2. IDEA-STAGE2.1 Exploring ideas, conducting market/customer research 2.2 Have started developing my idea3. PROTOTYPE (has concept, no revenues)3.1 Have an early (low-fidelity/paper) prototype (of product or service) 3.2 Have a functioning (high-fidelity) prototype with early users / early adopters4. EARLY-STAGE (have revenues, but not profitable)4.1 Declining revenues and the enterprise is not yet profitable/sustainable 4.2 Revenues are stagnant or growing slowly, but the enterprise is not yet profitable/sustainable 4.3 Revenues are growing quickly, but the enterprise is not yet profitable/sustainable5. GROWTH-STAGE (profitable)5.1 Established national enterprise (profitable/sustainable business, with stable, growing, or declining revenues) 5.2 Established multinational enterprise 5.3 Seeking scalability (of impact and/or profits) 5.4 Seeking diversification

messages.content:
come up with  5 example documents for the five levels for this question:
"Do we clearly and comprehensively understand our customers' and stakeholders' values and needs, and have we prioritized them?"

make a table

content.text:
come up with  5 example documents for the five levels for this question:
"Do we clearly and comprehensively understand our customers' and stakeholders' values and needs, and have we prioritized them?"

make a table

messages.content:
Here's a table with 5 example documents for each of the five levels for the question "Do we clearly and comprehensively understand our customers' and stakeholders' values and needs, and have we prioritized them?":

| Level | Example Document 1 | Example Document 2 | Example Document 3 | Example Document 4 | Example Document 5 |
|-------|-------------------|-------------------|-------------------|-------------------|-------------------|
| 1. IDEATION | Customer Profile Template | Stakeholder Mapping Worksheet | Market Research Plan | Customer Interview Guide | Empathy Mapping Canvas |
| 2. IDEA-STAGE | Target Market Segmentation Analysis | Customer Needs Assessment Survey | Stakeholder Prioritization Matrix | Focus Group Discussion Guide | Customer Journey Mapping Template |
| 3. PROTOTYPE | User Persona Template | Stakeholder Feedback Survey | Prototype Testing Plan | Customer Value Proposition Canvas | Stakeholder Communication Plan |
| 4. EARLY-STAGE | Customer Satisfaction Survey | Stakeholder Engagement Strategy | Net Promoter Score (NPS) Analysis | Customer Retention Plan | Stakeholder Influence Matrix |
| 5. GROWTH-STAGE | Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) Analysis | Stakeholder Relationship Management Plan | Customer Segmentation and Targeting Strategy | Stakeholder Satisfaction Survey | Customer Experience (CX) Improvement Roadmap |

These example documents provide a range of tools and templates that organizations can use to better understand, prioritize, and address the values and needs of their customers and stakeholders at each stage of their growth and development. By utilizing these resources, companies can ensure that they are making informed decisions and taking appropriate actions to meet the expectations and requirements of their key stakeholders.

messages.content: how do i make a progress bar where people can see all ten levels and have a single short description of being good at that stage?

content.text: how do i make a progress bar where people can see all ten levels and have a single short description of being good at that stage?

messages.content:
I want 10 levels and make a table going horizontally and have it say something like, starting or excellent at each stage. Something like, just starting ideation and doing ok, excellent at ideation. it will be how people answer the question for 
"Do we clearly and comprehensively understand our customers' and stakeholders' values and needs, and have we prioritized them?"

So they select their level and say how good they are at it - how can we do that so it's simple and progressive
